Welcome to Recipe Selector and Analyzer’s documentation!¶

Module arrays represents the needed data structures for the investigation. That is mostly based on the materials from the book Data Structures and Algorithms Using Python – R. Necaise.

class arrays.Array(size)[source]¶

Creates an array with size elements.

clear(value)[source]¶

(Array, value)

Clears the array by setting each element to the given value.

class arrays.DynamicArray[source]¶

A dynamic array class akin to a simplified Python list.

append(value)[source]¶

(DynamicArray, str)

Adds object to end of the array.

remove(value)[source]¶

(DynamicArray, str)

Removes the first occurrence of value. If thee is no such value raises ValueError.

Module recipe_search_adt represents the ADT for getting recipe data from json and helps to select needed information due to the certain search.

class recipe_search_adt.RecipeSearch(query, data)[source]¶

Gets needed information about recipes.

amount_of_recipes()[source]¶

(RecipeSearch) -> int

Returns the amount of recipes.

get_recipes()[source]¶

(RecipeSearch)

Gets needed recipe information from dictionary.

nutrients_per_day()[source]¶

(RecipeSearch) -> Array

Returns the array with amount of nutrients for the mealplans search.

recipe_ids()[source]¶

(RecipeSearch) -> DynamicArray

Returns the array with the recipes’ id numbers.

recipe_names()[source]¶

(RecipeSearch) -> DynamicArray

Returns the array with the recipes’ names.

recipe_selector(number)[source]¶

(RecipeSearch, int)

Selects recipes in the random way.

Module recipe_data_adt represents ADT for getting more information about recipes.

class recipe_data_adt.RecipeData(data, recipes, amount_of_recipes)[source]¶

Represents data container class for the recipe analysis.

add_data(main_information)[source]¶

(RecipeData, list)

Adds all needed information about all the recipes.

calories()[source]¶

(RecipeData) -> Array

Returns the array with the numbers of calories in all recipes.

cheap()[source]¶

(RecipeData) -> Array

Returns the array with values cheap or not cheap to cook a certain dish.

count_main_nutrients(main_nutrients, index)[source]¶

(RecipeData, list, int) -> int

Returns the amount of main nutrients in the dish.

get_ingredients(index)[source]¶

(RecipeData, int) -> DynamicArray

Gets the information about the ingredients of recipes.

get_recipe_urls()[source]¶

(RecipeData) -> Array

Returns the array of urls of all recipes.

healthiness()[source]¶

(RecipeData) -> Array

Returns the array with values of the healthiness of all recipes.

healthy_score()[source]¶

(RecipeData) -> Array

Returns the array with values of health score of all recipes.

ingredients()[source]¶

(RecipeData) -> DynamicArray

Returns the array of arrays with the ingredients of all dishes.

is_popular()[source]¶

(RecipeData) -> Array

Returns the array with values of popularity of all recipes.

main_nutrients_percents(main_nutrients, index)[source]¶

(RecipeData, list, int) -> Array

Returns the array of two arrays. First consists of the names of main nutrients with amounts and second consists of the percents of daily needs of those nutrients.

other_nutrients_percents(main_nutrients, index)[source]¶

(RecipeData, list, int) -> Array

Returns the array of two arrays. First consists of the names of vitamins, minerals, etc with amounts and second consists of the percents of daily needs of those vitamins and minerals.

recipe_nutrition(index)[source]¶

(RecipeData, int) -> DynamicArray

Gets nutrition information of the one recipe.

recipes()[source]¶

(RecipeData) -> DynamicArray

Returns the array of the names of all recipes.

recipes_main_information(main_info, index)[source]¶

(RecipeData, list, int) -> DynamicArray

Gets the main needed information about one recipe.

search_cuisines()[source]¶

(RecipeData) -> Array

Returns the array of cuisines of all recipes.

search_diets()[source]¶

(RecipeData) -> Array

Returns the array of diets of all recipes.

search_types()[source]¶

(RecipeData) -> Array

Returns the array of dish types of all recipes.

time_cooking()[source]¶

(RecipeData) -> Array

Returns the array with values of cooking time of all recipes.

Module main_functions represents main functions for getting and analyzing data

main_functions.check_data(data)[source]¶

(dict) -> str

Checks if the data from API is valid.

main_functions.check_input(add_url, more_options)[source]¶

(str, list)

Checks the input of the user.

main_functions.data_from_recipe_ids(recipes_data)[source]¶

(DynamicArray) -> list

Function that uses recipes’ ids to get information for recipes’ analysis.

main_functions.get_data_from_url(base_url, add_url, option, more_options=None)[source]¶

(str, str, str, list) -> dict

Gets information using API.

main_functions.ingredients_table(recipes, ingredients)[source]¶

(DynamicArray, DynamicArray) -> Figure

Function that makes a table from the information about the ingredients of the dishes.

main_functions.plot_nutrition(main_subs, value)[source]¶

(Array, str) -> Figure

Function that makes bar chart from the nutrition composition information.

Module complex_dashboard represents complex dashboard.

complex_dashboard.recipes_complex_data(data, number)[source]¶

(dict, int) -> RecipeData

Function that gets needed information and returns one for the further analysis.

Module meal_gen_dashboard represents meal generating dashboard.

meal_gen_dashboard.pie_chart_mealgenerator(information)[source]¶

(Array) -> Figure

Function that creates a pie chart for the meal generator.
